pros: Wonderful group of people to work with.
cons: Need more full time openings

review_title: Avoid unless you cannot get on elsewhere
pros: Lackadaisical atmosphere. Most full time faculty only work 4 days a week. Some full time faculty work only two days a week. There isn't much else that's positive.
cons:
Horrible administration whose only concern is lining their pockets at the expense of young students. 60% or more of Tusculum's students are athletes. Over 150 football athletes are recruited each fall with tremendous turnover in the spring. Most students just end up in massive debt.

The current president fired many upstanding faculty and staff to hire his friends from his former institutions. He's hoping his pipe dream programs are going to make him look like a hero, but most faculty believe he's doomed the university. Faculty morale is in the toilet. No raises for the three years I was an employee. Because of that, most faculty are lazy and only do enough to get by. 

Several accreditation programs are going through or are complete that are, more or less, works of fiction. Faculty turnover is bad. Most are recruited with huge promises, realize what's going on and get out as soon as possible, leaving only those who cannot find jobs anywhere else. There are a lot of faculty and staff who have been promoted to incompetence. 

Prospective faculty, staff, and students should look elsewhere. There are better, higher paying and cheaper options in the area.

review_title: Enjoyed my time working for Tusculum College
pros: Dedicated employees who care about their work; a close-knit community; supportive division directors; PTO time is very generous; two week paid holiday at Christmas; senior leadership and board members seem to genuinely care about the welfare of the students, faculty, and staff
cons: Salaries are less than comparable institutions in the region; college is tuition driven which means revenue can be uncertain at times

review_title: Went home crying every day! Toxic environment!
pros: I can think of very little positive to say about my time at Tusculum. The two weeks off at Christmas was nice, even though we still had to work a couple of those days. And the PTO policy is generous...when you can actually get your PTO requests approved.
cons: Tusculum had the WORST workplace culture and environment of any place I have ever worked.  Employee morale, especially with the new President, was rock bottom.  Supervisor micromanaged everything and had zero professionalism. Overall a very toxic work environment and every low wages, even for the area.  The college always had a budget crisis and with the new administration, job security is out the door.

review_title: I absolutely love the students, but the way administration treats faculty and staff is appalling.
pros: Faculty and staff are wonderful. The campus is beautiful.  In my opinion you could not find a better sense of community within the two groups.
cons: Administrative support is lacking, there is virtually no communication on plans for the college. Faculty meetings are a joke. Why vote on some things if the board and administration is going to do whatever they want anyway? Faculty have no power.

review_title: A nice, private small-town college to work for...
pros:
-Faculty and staff are very nice
-Work and life balance are wonderful
cons:
-Salary is above average for the small town but not adequate when compared to the cost of living increases in the area and when compared to neighboring, larger cities
-Not much room for advancement, can take several years to move up into a higher position due to the small campus
-Benefits are costly since it is a small college

pros: The scenery of the small town and mountains are breathtakingly beautiful
cons: The school is not a good place to work. Administration and coaches are infectious to student population. The school is not in a good place financially and almost closed permanently two years ago. In addition, the Deans and Department Chairs are inept to perform their daily duties and they reflect less than professional demeanor or supervisory skills. The school promises things in job interviews to woo you in... but it is all lies, so please do not waste your time applying to this place.

review_title: Lots of freedom to teach in your own style
pros: Block system is very productive for my teaching.
cons: Communication with faculty and staff is very unorganized.

pros: Solid faculty. Great facilities. Great location.
cons: Terrible administration. Faculty are intimidated and left fearful of termination. Political correctness is the chief virtue of the administration. Male faculty are especially targeted for intimidation.

review_title: Good experience but doesn't pay well.
pros: Good benefits and excellent PTO benefits!! Offers free tuition after a year of service to spouse and children for an undergraduate degree. Offers Aflac.
cons: Doesn't pay well. They don't treat their employees well and communication is terrible. Will not pay for a graduate degree to spouse or children.

review_title: Unprepared staff willing to bend the rules for the students they like.
pros: Centrally located, cheap, but again, cheap tuition yields poor education for most people, avoid at all costs.
cons: Level of education offered is the major con, don't waste your money, find a better school. Just because they are the oldest school in TN doesn't make them good... would you want the oldest doctor in the state performing your surgery, no.

pros: great coworkers, flexible work hours,  making a positive difference in the lives of others
cons: unequal pay,  retirement not covered,  lack of money for staff development,

pros: There are no pros for Tusculum College.
cons: Administration is terrible. They are overpaid and allow a toxic culture to take place. Do not work here. Much better opportunities elsewhere for faculty.

pros: Good schedule. Prompt payment. Engaged students.
cons: Adjuncts are kinda left on their own with little support. IT needs in classroom are antiquated.

pros: Great people! You get real close to your staff.
cons: RA management not coordinated and not flexible. Last minute planning.

pros: Students get hands on experience and marketable skills
cons: Decision Making by Upper Management has caused the college to be in a non-competitive position

review_title: Laid back  job with good staff
job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Tusculum, TN
pros: Fair pay and work with good people.
cons: It's in a very small town. Long term shift changes.

pros: Small Place that could have family feel
cons: Small and unprofessional and secluded and don't know what they are doing.

pros: Beautiful campus, nice people to work with
cons: Has no idea what they are doing

pros: Small college so close-net community
cons: Non professional Administration promoting unqualified individuals and showing complete disrespect to knowledgeable and experienced faculty and staff & over work and extremely underpaid
